result.execSummary:
The defendant Lemar C Newell Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lemar C Newell Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lemar C Newell Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant is to provide for DNA and pay applicable costs and surcharge.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*Restitution is set at $0.
*CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED AND BALANCE RETURNED TO SURETY.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*NO contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Parenting classes.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lemar C Newell Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
9/11/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded as to count 4.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 13 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
 -Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. Parenting classes.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant is to provide for DNA and pay applicable costs and surcharge.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at $0.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED AND BALANCE RETURNED TO SURETY.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for trial today.  Parties have reached a resolution.
Upon motion of the state counts 1,2,3, are ordered DISMISSED.
AS to count 4:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Case is adjourned for sentencing.
Upon motion of the defense  and without objection by the state, the court will remove the GPS, but Justicepoint supervision is to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Justice Point Case Worker Samantha Socha appeared in court.  Court reviewed violation and discussed with Ms. Socha.  Court adjourns violation to the next court date.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse..

15RM025180  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-18-2015

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with Attorney Michael Jude for Attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery and offer letter turned over to defense counsel by the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-17-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 8-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Nigeria N., no violations of the law, cooperate with Justice Point Supervision if released, absolute sobriety and no guns, until further order of the Court.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Absolutely No Release From Home (24 hour curfew).  mld

Attorney Terese Dick in court for Attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Lemar C Newell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  The Court maintains the current bail and added gps supervision as a condition of bail.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defense counsel requests adjournment for bail hearing.  Court orders case adjourned for bail hearing in Branch 4.

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant taken into custody.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nigeria N.    AND/OR  their residence    AND/OR  their place of employment

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-087

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 

As to Counts 3 and 4:
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/15 @ 1:30pm
